meanings.definition: A loud, resonant sound or noise.
meanings.sent1: The klongs of the church bells echoed through the town.
meanings.sent2: I heard the klongs of thunder in the distance.
meanings.sent3: The klongs of the pots and pans clashing together woke up the entire house.
meanings.sent4: The klongs of the gong signaled the start of the ceremony.
meanings.sent5: The klongs of the fireworks filled the night sky with color and sound.

meanings.definition: To make a loud, resonant sound.
meanings.sent1: The blacksmith klongs the hammer against the metal to shape it.
meanings.sent2: The drum klongs loudly in the music band.
meanings.sent3: The old car klongs and sputters before finally starting.
meanings.sent4: The door klongs shut behind him, making everyone jump.
meanings.sent5: The bell klongs as the children run out for recess, filling the schoolyard with joy.

meanings.sent1: The klongs of the empty barrel rolling down the hill echoed in the valley.
meanings.sent2: The klongs of the wind chimes in the garden soothed her mind.
meanings.sent3: The klongs of the distant train made her think of faraway places.
meanings.sent4: The klongs of the old well being drawn from brought relief to the villagers.
meanings.sent5: The klongs of the foghorn warned ships of the rocky shore ahead.
